definition: hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to take revenge and erase humiliation (idiom)
lit. for a nobleman to take revenge, ten years is not too long (idiom)/fig. revenge is a dish best served cold
pinyin: jun1 zi5 bao4 chou2 , shi2 nian2 bu4 wan3

sentences.english: I have an inappropriate question: Can Buddhist avenge?
sentences.chinese: 問個不恰當的問題，學佛人可以報仇嗎？

sentences.english: Power the daughter swears to revenge for father really.
sentences.chinese: 威的女兒真真誓要替父報仇。

sentences.english: For it is the day of the LORD's vengeance, and the year of recompences for the controversy of Zion.
sentences.chinese: 因耶和華有報仇之日，爲錫安的爭辯，有報應之年。

sentences.english: He wanted to avenge the death of his younger brother, who had been killed by Vishnu.
sentences.chinese: 他想爲遭毗溼奴殺害的弟弟報仇。

sentences.english: She swears that she will be avenged on her enemy sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 她發誓遲早要向她的敵人報仇。

sentences.english: Peishan asks Zhenghong to join in her plan to take revenge on Jinlong and Mingzhang.
sentences.chinese: 佩珊邀正鴻加入計劃向金龍和明章報仇。

sentences.english: The cat revenged herself on him by scratching him.
sentences.chinese: 那隻貓抓傷他向他報仇。

sentences.english: 16 at the taunts of those who reproach and revile me, because of the enemy, who is bent on revenge.
sentences.chinese: 都因那辱罵毀謗人的聲音，又因仇敵和報仇人的緣故。

sentences.english: They pant for an opportunity of revenging that humiliation;
sentences.chinese: 他們渴望着一次洗涮恥辱，報仇的機會。

sentences.english: Arab League wolf et al. , for revenges for Brother Jiang, has massacred in a big way.
sentences.chinese: 阿狼等人爲了替江氏兄弟報仇，殘殺了大大。

sentences.english: Anor hoped to strike back at Overlord Shimrra in revenge for his misfortune.
sentences.chinese: 阿諾希望對希姆拉霸主發動反擊，爲自己的不幸報仇。

sentences.english: Abjection 3 people decide to form an alliance, revenge for each other.
sentences.chinese: 落魄的三人決定結盟，替彼此報仇。

sentences.english: We avenged ourselves on  our enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我們向我們的敵人報仇。

sentences.english: Yet he became very annoyed and resolved to find a means of avenging himself.
sentences.chinese: 可他又非常非常的惱怒，決定找個法子報仇雪恨。

sentences.english: Kill lost Chen Lianshi Liao Sicheng choices, revenge Yao Lixing.
sentences.chinese: 廖思成抉擇殺失落陳連石，替姚立星報仇。

sentences.english: Now is the time for you to pay off old scores.
sentences.chinese: 現在是你報仇雪恨的時候了。

definition: to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
